post.author: 강윤정
post.content:
Does anyone work with Webservice development?
When we use automation tool such as WSDL2JAVA or JAVA2WSDL through command line or Websphere studio, the tool generates all kind of java classes for conversion between java and XML. Once these classes are generated, any simple change on WSDL file or java class to add some more functionalities require to run the tool from scratch. Even I have a concern of the existing implementation classes might be overriden by that automated class generation when I use WSDL2JAVA approach.
I find this quite cumbersome and wonder if this approach of depending on that automated tool makes sense practically in real development field.
I'd like to hear your experience with Webservice development - what kind of tools, servers, how to manage this SOAP message and JAVA mapping...
post.title: Question about Webservice
